extends java.lang.Object
    KIT101 Assignment 2 WereWolfenstein 2D -- Library class See also the Result enumerated type (in Result.java).

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameWorld

        public GameWorld(boolean traceOnOff)
        Creates a game world for the WereWolfenstein 2D game.
        Parameters:
        traceOnOff - whether or not tracing output should be shown

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentArea

        public int getCurrentArea()
        Returns the number of the current area.
        Returns:
        which area number player is within

      • getShotCount

        public java.lang.String getShotCount()
        Returns the number of shot attempts, formatted as "total hits/total required"
        Returns:
        the fraction of shots that have hit the werewolf (out of the required number of hits)

      • getVillagePopulation

        public int getVillagePopulation()
        Returns the current number of villagers.
        Returns:
        the villager count, >= 0

      • getActionsUntilNight

        public int getActionsUntilNight()
        Returns the number of actions remaining until dawn arrives.
        Returns:
        actions remaining until dawn event

      • newGame

        public int newGame(Difficulty difficulty)
        Randomly determines a unique starting location (currentArea), village position (villagePos) and werewolf position (wolfPos).
        Parameters:
        difficulty - - the difficulty level of the game
        Returns:
        the starting location (area)

      • resetWolfPosition

        private void resetWolfPosition()
        Randomly determines a unique location for werewolf (wolfPos).

      • werewolfNear

        public Result werewolfNear()
        Returns the nearness of the werewolf.
        Returns:
        Status of werewolf's location BITTEN: if player is currently bitten (and delirious) NEAR: if werewolf is in a connected area FAR: if werewolf is elsewhere

      • isVillageNear

        public boolean isVillageNear()
        Returns true if the village is near the player (in an adjacent area), false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the player is near (but not in) the village, false otherwise.

      • nearnessTo

        private Result nearnessTo(int area)
        Returns the nearness of the player to the nominated area.
        Parameters:
        area - the area (werewolf or village) to assess
        Returns:
        Nearness of player to nominated area NEAR: if player is adjacent to area FAR: if player is not adjacent to the area

      • tryWalk

        public Result tryWalk(int into)
        Try to move the player to another area. If the move is not IMPOSSIBLE then the number of actions remaining before dawn arrives is decremented.
        Parameters:
        into - the area to try to move into
        Returns:
        Result of the movement attempt SUCCESS: move was successful (current position changed) VILLAGE: move was successful and player has arrived in the village (and is not longer bitten) BITTEN: move was successful but player encountered the werewolf FAILURE: move was successful but already bitten player encountered the werewolf again IMPOSSIBLE: move was impossible (current position not changed)

      • shoot

        public Result shoot(int into)
        Try to shoot a silver bullet at the werewolf from the current area. If the shot is not IMPOSSIBLE then the number of actions remaining before dawn arrives is decremented.
        Parameters:
        into - the area to attempt to shoot into
        Returns:
        status of attempt CAPTURED: werewolf has been subdued and captured SUCCESS: werewolf has been hit but is not yet captured VILLAGE: the shot went into the village and a villager has died FAILURE: werewolf not present IMPOSSIBLE: area not connected

      • checkForDawn

        public boolean checkForDawn()
        Checks if there are no more actions left until dawn arrives. If dawn is here then decrements the number of villagers, repositions the werewolf and resets the number of actions until dawn arrives again. Returns true if dawn occurred, false if it did not.
        Returns:
        true if dawn just happened, false if has not yet arrived

      • areasConnected

        private boolean areasConnected(int s1,
                               int s2)
        Returns true if areas s1 and s2 are connected, false otherwise. Also returns false if either area is an invalid area identifier.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first area
        s2 - the second area
        Returns:
        true if areas are connected, false otherwise

      • nextArea

        public int nextArea(char direction)
        Determine ID number of an adjacent area given its direction from the current area.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction to look (n for north, e for east, s for south, w for west)
        Returns:
        number of the area in that direction
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if direction is null

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets all game values.

      • setTracing

        public void setTracing(boolean shouldTrace)
        Turn tracing messages on or off. If off then it is assumed that debugging is not occurring and so a new (unseeded) random number generator is created so the game is unpredictable.
        Parameters:
        shouldTrace - indicates if tracing messages should be displayed or not

      • trace

        public void trace(java.lang.String message)
        Prints the given tracing message if tracing is enabled.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be displayed
